An award under this subsection shall be expended for any of the following activities needed to 
treat individuals with a specified infectious disease:
Renovating, constructing, or retrofitting a hospital or building.
Purchasing mobile specialized infectious disease isolation units and equipment.

Acquiring personal protective equipment  to be used by health care workers during management
			 of patients.

Hiring additional staff as necessary to replace staff assigned to treat individuals with a
			 specified
			 infectious disease.
Overtime of existing staff for treatment of individuals with a specified infectious disease.

Handling, transporting, and disposing of waste related to the specialized treatment of a specified
			 infectious disease.
Covering direct and indirect costs associated with treatment of a specified infectious disease.
Training health care professionals and other hospital staff, as appropriate, regarding—
procedures and protocols with respect to a specified infectious disease;
appropriate use of personal protective equipment;

screening questions, triage techniques, and health information
			 technology related to an infectious disease, such as Ebola;

identification, testing, and specimen collection and transport procedures with respect to a
			 specified infectious disease;
isolation and quarantine procedures;
cleaning and disinfection protocols;

handling, transporting, and disposing of waste related to the specialized treatment of a specified
			 infectious disease; or
handling of human remains of patients with a specified infectious disease.
